**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
As was pointed out in #3829 when we were updating `NameNode.declare_from_annotation()`, PEP 526 [supports assigning an `__annotations__` dict to a module scope](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0526/#runtime-effects-of-type-annotations) as well, however we're explicitly ignoring annotations at the module scope.


**Describe the solution you'd like**
This would provide the following functionality:
```cython
# foo.py

bar: str = "bar"

print(__annotations__)
#> {'bar': 'str'}
```

```cython
# other_module.py

import foo

print(foo.__annotations__)
#> {'bar': 'str'}
```
title: Support PEP 526 Module-Scoped Annotations
